Messages.Message: Student scores on the Latin Proficiency assessments are assigned to one of four achievement levels based on the scale score.

ReportAssessmentType.ClaimAchievementMessage: {0}''s results are also reported out into the five domains (i.e., areas) that together make up Latin proficiency: Translation, Grammar and Syntax, Reading Comprehension, Vocabulary and Listening and Speaking. To view a description of the student's achievement level claim (i.e., area), select either [Progressing], or [Well Developed] from the student-level selections available in the table below.

ReportPerformanceLevels.ReportPerformanceLevel: {0} did not meet the standard for Latin proficiency needed for likely success in future coursework.
{0} nearly met the standard for Latin proficiency needed for likely success in future coursework.
{0} has made progress and met the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
{0} has made progress and exceeded the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
{0} demonstrates some ability to translate simple sentences and passages with the use of repetition to assist comprehension.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to translate simple sentences and passages with the use of repetition to assist comprehension.
{0} demonstrates some ability to understand and identify basic Latin declensions, conjugations, and sentence structure.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to understand and identify basic Latin declensions, conjugations, and sentence structure.
{0} demonstrates some ability to read closely and analytically understand a range of Latin words, phrases, simple sentences, and dialogues.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to read closely and analytically understand a range of Latin words, phrases, simple sentences, and dialogues.
{0} demonstrates some knowledge of Latin vocabulary to explain the meaning of Latin words and phrases in context.
{0} demonstrates a thorough knowledge of Latin vocabulary to explain the meaning of Latin words and phrases in context.
{0} demonstrates some ability to understand simple Latin phrases spoken aloud, as well as engage in a short dialogue.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to understand simple Latin phrases spoken aloud, as well as engage in a short dialogue.

ReportAssessmentType.ClaimAchievementMessage: {0}''s results are also reported out into the five domains (i.e., areas) that together make up Latin proficiency: Translation, Grammar and Syntax, Reading Comprehension, Vocabulary and Listening and Speaking. {0} nearly met the standard for Latin proficiency needed for likely success in future coursework.
{0} has made progress and met the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
{0} has made progress and exceeded the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
{0} demonstrates some ability to translate simple sentences and passages with the use of repetition to assist comprehension.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to translate simple sentences and passages with the use of repetition to assist comprehension.
{0} demonstrates some ability to understand and identify basic Latin declensions, conjugations, and sentence structure.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to understand and identify basic Latin declensions, conjugations, and sentence structure.
{0} demonstrates some ability to read closely and analytically understand a range of Latin words, phrases, simple sentences, and dialogues.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to read closely and analytically understand a range of Latin words, phrases, simple sentences, and dialogues.
{0} demonstrates some knowledge of Latin vocabulary to explain the meaning of Latin words and phrases in context.
{0} demonstrates a thorough knowledge of Latin vocabulary to explain the meaning of Latin words and phrases in context.
{0} demonstrates some ability to understand simple Latin phrases spoken aloud, as well as engage in a short dialogue.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to understand simple Latin phrases spoken aloud, as well as engage in a short dialogue.

ReportAssessmentType.ClaimAchievementMessage: {0}''s results are also reported out into the five domains (i.e., areas) that together make up Latin proficiency: Translation, Grammar and Syntax, Reading Comprehension, Vocabulary and Listening and Speaking. To view a description of the student's achievement level claim (i.e., area), select either [Progressing], or [Well Developed] from the student-level selections available in the table below.

ReportPerformanceLevels.ReportPerformanceLevel: {0} did not meet the standard for Latin proficiency needed for likely success in future coursework.
{0} nearly met the standard for Latin proficiency needed for likely success in future coursework.
{0} has made progress and met the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
{0} has made progress and exceeded the standard for Latin proficiency. {0} appears ready for future coursework.
{0} demonstrates some knowledge of Roman culture and literary conventions, as well as Latin morphology to translate Latin text to English.
{0} demonstrates a thorough knowledge of Roman culture and literary conventions, as well as Latin morphology to translate Latin text to English.
{0} demonstrates some ability to identify grammatical forms and syntactic structures, as well as identifying stylistic features in Latin poetry and prose.
{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to identify grammatical forms and syntactic structures, as well as identifying stylistic features in Latin poetry and prose.
{0} demonstrates some ability to read closely and analytically understand a range of Latin texts (e.g., poetry, dialogues, speeches) of moderate complexity.

{0} demonstrates a thorough ability to read closely and analytically understand a range of Latin texts (e.g., poetry, dialogues, speeches) of moderate complexity. {0} uses knowledge of authors or literary conventions to demonstrate understanding.
{0} demonstrates some contextual knowledge of vocabulary to make connections to other disciplines as well as comparisons between Latin and English usages.
{0} demonstrates a thorough contextual knowledge of vocabulary to make connections to other disciplines as well as comparisons between Latin and English usages.
{0} demonstrates some listening and speaking skills to articulate a claim or thesis in Latin as part of a dialogue.
{0} demonstrates effective listening and speaking skills to articulate a claim or thesis in Latin as part of a dialogue.
